intro: Aneilema schweinfurthii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its upright stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces violet or purple flowers that are clustered in inflorescences at the top of the stems. Its leaves are usually ovate or lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Aneilema schweinfurthii is often cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
